reference.title: Export Android Package Files dialog
reference.shortdesc: Creates an Android Package file (.apk) for each APK configuration of each selected project. This dialog appears when you select Export from the File menu, and then select Android Export Android Application using MOTODEV Studio for Android from the list of export destinations.

strow.stentry: Lists all of the projects in the current workspace. Specify at least one project to be exported.

If selected, the Android Package file for each project is placed within that project's dist directory. If this option is not selected, the Android Package files are all placed in the directory indicated by the Destination field. This option is selected by default.
Specifies the directory into which the Android Package files are stored. This field is only valid if Use default destination is not selected.

If selected, the exported Android Packages are signed according to the remaining fields in this section. Note that if you do not sign the Android Package when you export it, you can later sign it by right-clicking it in the Package Explorer view and selecting Sign Android Package from the MOTODEV Studio for Android menu.

Specify the keystore that contains the key to be used during the signing process. If the keystore is already known to (and listed in) the Signing and Keys view, select it from the drop-down list. Otherwise, click Use existing to specify an existing keystore that is not yet known to the Signing and Keys view, or Add new to create and use a new keystore.
Specify the key within the chosen keystore to be used for signing. Select an existing key from the drop-down list, or create a new key in the keystore by selecting Add.
